clinical_study.brief_title: Single Oral Dose of 60 mg [14C]AZD9668 in Healthy Male Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Single-Centre, Phase I Study to Assess the Excretion, Metabolism and Plasma Pharmacokinetics Following a Single Oral Dose of 60 mg [14C]AZD9668 in Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to characterise the absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion (ADME) of a single oral dose of [14C]AZD9668.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of radioactive dose recovered in urine and faeces and total balance
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples collected prior to treatment, during treatment and follow-up for a maximum of 14 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentration of total radioactivity in blood and plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples collected prior to treatment, during treatment and follow-up for a maximum of 14 days.
Samples collected prior to treatment, during treatment and follow-up for a maximum of 14 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Metabolite profiling and identification in plasma and excreta
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples collected prior to treatment, during treatment and follow-up for a maximum of 14 days.

primary_outcome.measure: PK of AZD9668 (Cmax, tmax, tÂ½, AUC, CL/F, Vz/F, MRT, fe, Ae, CLR )
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples collected prior to treatment, during treatment and follow-up for a maximum of 14 days.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Adverse events collected prior to treatment and after treatment including follow up.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of signed, written and dated informed consent prior to any study specific procedure
- Have a body mass index (BMI) between 18 and 30 kg/m2 and weigh at least 50 kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Exposed to radiation levels above background of >5 mSv in the last year, >10 mSv over the last 5 years or a cumulative total of >1 mSv per year of life
- History or presence of any clinically significant disease or disorder in the opinion of the investigator
- Any clinically relevant abnormal findings in physical examination, clinical chemistry, haematology, urinalysis, vital signs or ECG at baseline in the opinion of the investigator

overall_official.affiliation: Quintiles Drug Research Unit, United Kingdom
